title: Danielle Scott (tennis)
text:
Danielle Scott (born March 22, 1970) is a former professional <a href="tennis">tennis</a> player from the United States.
Biography.
Scott attended <a href="Corona%20del%20Mar%20High%20School">Corona del Mar High School</a> in <a href="Newport%20Beach%2C%20California">Newport Beach, California</a> and was a two-time All-American tennis player at the <a href="University%20of%20Arizona">University of Arizona</a>.
Professional tennis.
In the 1990s she played on the professional tennis tour, where she made most of her WTA Tour appearances in doubles.
Ranked as high as 75 in doubles, Scott competed in the main draw of all four <a href="Grand%20Slam%20%28tennis%29">grand slam</a> tournaments. At the <a href="1994%20US%20Open%20%28tennis%29">1994 US Open</a>, she and <a href="Elly%20Hakami">Elly Hakami</a> made the round of 16 of the women's doubles, as a wildcard pairing. She also reached the round of 16 of the women's doubles at the <a href="1995%20Australian%20Open">1995 Australian Open</a> with <a href="Wiltrud%20Probst">Wiltrud Probst</a>, which included a win over sixth seeds <a href="Julie%20Halard-Decugis">Julie Halard-Decugis</a> and <a href="Pam%20Shriver">Pam Shriver</a>.
